oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Robert E. Lee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This postwar photograph of Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee was made by the Boude and Miley Studio. It is signed "Regards from Harry B. Hawes" in the lower right corner. Hawes represented Missouri in the U.S. House of Representatives (1921-1926) and Senate (1926-1933). This image could possibly be one of a series of reprints were made from the negatives in the 1930s. Hawes' father, a captain in the Confederate army, was badly wounded in the Battle of Shiloh.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
